paragraphs.text: The hapless, harmless Palestinian leader?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: January 15 marks a decade since Mahmoud Abbas became the Palestinian president
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: during which time the goals he claims to espouse not only remain unrealised, but are more remote than ever
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He is still in office despite his term ending six years ago; the democratic process that brought him to power no longer in existence
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He speaks of his people's human rights
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while his Palestinian Authority actively curtails them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He claims to champion their national rights while collaborating unconditionally with the country that denies them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Abbas' image as a hapless, harmless figure deflects from the cunning and ruthlessness of someone whose primary concern, like the Middle East's other autocrats, seems to be his longevity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The fact that he plays ball with the West and Israel somehow makes this okay
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Where other Arab strongmen nurture an image of power to maintain it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: he relies on being seen as an underdog
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But this illusion, which has traditionally served Abbas well, no longer extends to his people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many think he and the PA serve their own interests and those of Israel, rather than those of the Palestinians
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: According to a poll last month, 55 percent believe that the PA has become "a burden on the Palestinian people"
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Regarding the presidency, Abbas has consistently lagged in opinion polls behind his Fatah colleague, Marwan Barghouti
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Since Israel's last Gaza invasion, he also runs behind Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Is it mere coincidence, then, that Abbas has been lacklustre in campaigning for Barghouti's release from Israeli jail; or in pursuing and implementing national unity deals with Hamas that call for elections?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Since the signing of the latest reconciliation agreement in April, Abbas has at various times threatened to end it, and has been openly adversarial towards Hamas
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Elections that were due within six months never happened
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he remains unchallenged
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: this has gone largely unnoticed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The PA - which is meant to safeguard Palestinian rights- serially abuses them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Human Rights Watch has documented "police beatings and arbitrary arrests of demonstrators", "excessive force", "repressing critical news reporting and demonstrations", "suppressing dissenting views", and "serious rights abuses, including credible allegations of torture"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: for which "no security officials were convicted"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: As such, the PA is not only failing to curb Israeli abuses, but is busy perpetrating its own, all under Abbas' watch
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The PA has garnered a reputation among Palestinians for managing the occupation rather than striving to end it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One way it does this is "security coordination" with Israel
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which Abbas described last year as "sacred" despite the vast majority of Palestinians opposing it
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Such coordination serves Israel by enabling it to subcontract its occupation, and serves the PA by helping it suppress internal dissent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It certainly does not benefit the Palestinian people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Abbas and his foreign minister have made grotesque assurances that as long as he is president, he will not allow an uprising against Israel
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: So the PA, which is supposed to be part of a national liberation struggle, is willing to put down an uprising by its own people against their subjugation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is nothing short of betrayal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For more than 20 years, the PA has participated in a "peace process" that has greatly entrenched Israeli control
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Abbas himself was an architect of the disastrous Oslo Accords
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The occupied territories are now so colonised and fragmented that a viable Palestinian state is widely considered impossible
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Abbas still wants to negotiate, despite Israel being clearly opposed to Palestinian self-determination
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What, then, is the point of negotiating?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Perhaps to preserve the privileged elites to which the PA and the "peace process" gave birth
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After all
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: allegations of corruption and nepotism, including Abbas and his family, are nothing new
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With the help of international aid, the PA is the largest employer of Palestinians, much like other autocracies that encourage public dependence on the state to avoid mass unrest
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A power imbalance alone cannot explain Abbas' policy choices regarding Israel
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He opposes armed resistance, and has gone to great lengths to disarm militants in the West Bank
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he also opposes peaceful forms of resistance, including the increasingly effective Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions movement
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Furthermore
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it took the PA more than two years since Palestine's upgraded UN status to apply to join the International Criminal Court, despite repeated threats to do so amid constant Israeli provocations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That Abbas finally relented may not only, or necessarily, be about losing patience with Israel, but about assuaging mounting Palestinian anger at his procrastination in applying to the ICC
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Meanwhile, he says he will keep pushing for a UN Security Council resolution calling for a deadline to end Israel's occupation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: despite the certainty of repeated failure by US veto
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Abbas seems to be attempting a balancing act
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He wants to prove to Israel, and his western and Arab backers, that he is their best Palestinian partner, safe in the knowledge that they will not accept Hamas rule, but mindful not to suffer the same fate as Yasser Arafat once he was no longer deemed useful or reliable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: his recent, uncharacteristic defiance against Israel reflects a need to stop his flagging domestic popularity turning into an uprising against him and the PA
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Abbas has nothing to show his people after 10 years as president, and at least another decade as part of the "peace process"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He remains in office because of, not despite, Israel's occupation and Palestinian disunity
paragraphs.label: assumption
